channel.title: Mozconfigwrapper on Hunting the Shmoo
channel.description: Recent content in Mozconfigwrapper on Hunting the Shmoo

item.title: A Workflow for using Mach with multiple Object Directories
item.description: Mach is an amazing tool which facilitates a large number of common user stories in the mozilla source tree. You can perform initial setup, execute a build, run tests, examine diagnostics, even search Google. Many of these things require an object directory. This can potentially lead to some confusion if you typically have more than one object directory at any given time. How does mach know which object directory to operate on?

item.title: An Easier way to Manage Mozconfigs
item.description: Mozconfigwrapper is a tool inspired by Doug Hellman’s magnificent virtualenvwrapper. In a nutshell, mozconfigwrapper hides all of your mozconfigs into a configurable directory (defaults to ~/.mozconfigs), and lets you easily switch, create, remove, edit and list them. Mozconfigwrapper is Unix only for now.
